import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
from matplotlib import dates

import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.offline as py
import plotly.graph_objs as go
import plotly
plotly.offline.init_notebook_mode(connected=True)

import matplotlib

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.f857f52c:
#word cloud
from wordcloud import WordCloud, ImageColorGenerator
text = " ".join(str(each) for each in df.mood)
# Create and generate a word cloud image:
wordcloud = WordCloud(max_words=200,colormap='Set3', background_color="black").generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
# Display the generated image:
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='Bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.figure(1,figsize=(12, 12))
plt.show()

#Code by Benjamin Obi Tayo https://towardsdatascience.com/how-to-remove-sign-from-data-table-baa37598982a

df1['4th Jul 2019'] = list(map(lambda x: x[:-1], df1['4th Jul 2019'].values))
df1['11th Jul 2019'] = list(map(lambda x: x[:-1], df1['11th Jul 2019'].values))
df1['18th Jul 2019'] = list(map(lambda x: x[:-1], df1['18th Jul 2019'].values))

df1['4th Jun 2020'] = list(map(lambda x: x[:-1], df1['4th Jun 2020'].values))
df1['8th Oct 2020'] = list(map(lambda x: x[:-1], df1['8th Oct 2020'].values))
df1['9th Sep 2021'] = list(map(lambda x: x[:-1], df1['9th Sep 2021'].values))
source.b18f0af5:
#Code by Benjamin Obi Tayo https://towardsdatascience.com/how-to-remove-sign-from-data-table-baa37598982a

#Convert (string) to Numeric    Save for the next because they are already numeric here.

df1['4th Jul 2019'] = [int(x) for x in df1['4th Jul 2019'].values]
df1['11th Jul 2019'] = [int(x) for x in df1['11th Jul 2019'].values]
df1['18th Jul 2019'] = [int(x) for x in df1['18th Jul 2019'].values]

df1['4th Jun 2020'] = [int(x) for x in df1['4th Jun 2020'].values]
df1['8th Oct 2020'] = [int(x) for x in df1['8th Oct 2020'].values]
df1['9th Sep 2021'] = [int(x) for x in df1['9th Sep 2021'].values]
source.11c2a30f:
df_grp = df1.groupby(["mood"])[["4th Jul 2019","11th Jul 2019","18th Jul 2019", "4th Jun 2020", "8th Oct 2020", "9th Sep 2021"]].sum().reset_index()
df_grp.head()
source.853bcd17:
fig = px.bar(df, 
             x='mood', y='4th Jul 2019', color_discrete_sequence=['#DC143C'],
             title='Britains moods in 4th Jul 2019', text='4th Jul 2019')

fig.update_layout(barmode='stack', xaxis={'categoryorder':'total descending'})
fig.show()
source.5d14df54:
#Codes by Tawej https://www.kaggle.com/tawejssh/covid-19

plt.figure(figsize=(20,7))
plt.plot(df_grp['4th Jul 2019'], label='4th Jul 2019')
plt.plot(df_grp['11th Jul 2019'], label='11th Jul 2019')
plt.plot(df_grp['18th Jul 2019'], label='18th Jul 2019')
plt.plot(df_grp['4th Jun 2020'], label='4th Jun 2020')
plt.plot(df_grp['8th Oct 2020'], label='8th Oct 2020')
plt.plot(df_grp['9th Sep 2021'], label='9th Sep 2021')

plt.legend()
#plt.grid()
plt.title('Britains Moods')
plt.xticks(df_grp.index,rotation=45)
plt.xlabel('Moods')
plt.ylabel('Count')

sns.set_style("dark")
plt.show()
